brief_description: Wrist actigraphy was obtained for two weeks before conception and then throughout pregnancy. Chronotype was measured by determining the time of sleep onset from the actigraphy profile of each 24-hour period (12 PM to 12 PM the next day) during the first (gestational weeks 4 through 13), second (weeks 14 through 27) and third trimesters (week 28 until delivery).
brief_title: Pregnancy induces an earlier chronotype in both mice and women
description: Wrist actigraphy was obtained for two weeks before conception and then throughout pregnancy. Chronotype was measured by determining the time of sleep onset from the actigraphy profile of each 24-hour period (12 PM to 12 PM the next day) during the first (gestational weeks 4 through 13), second (weeks 14 through 27) and third trimesters (week 28 until delivery).
hypothesis: To better understand the mechanisms responsible for abnormal pregnancy outcomes following circadian disruption, we first need to understand normal maternal circadian rhythms during pregnancy
objectives: The objective of this study was to determine whether daily rhythms change during pregnancy in mice and women.
official_title: Pregnancy induces an earlier chronotype in both mice and women

personnel.site_name: March of Dimes Prematurity Research Center at Washington University
